body: This is the desired behavior. We use the file extension to determine the loading behavior of the file, e.g. `.stories.ts` are handled differently from `.stories.js`/`.mdx`/`.stories.svelte`. I think what's missing here is documentation on how to customize the indexing behavior for `.storiestest.tsx`. WDYT @jonniebigodes ?

Thanks for your quick answer. Maybe my description was a bit ambiguous. I didn't want to talk about extensions but more about the file sufix before them. For example, I'd like storybook to look for `[file].whatever.ts` rather than `[file].stories.ts`.
Notice that this change (as described above) was working properly before the latest beta version.
@shilman any chance to reconsider that as a bug? ðŸ˜ƒ

rename.from: [Bug]: [7.0.0-beta.19]: Unable to change story loading globing parttern for something else than `stories`
rename.to: [Bug]: [7.0.0-beta.20]: Unable to change story loading globing parttern for something else than `stories`

body: @shilman & @jonniebigodes  I can take over this docs task. I already know of the issue and wrote about it @ https://sheriffmoose.medium.com/storybook-markdown-docs-not-mdx-part-2-757463fcad84

issue.title: docs: add documentation for story indexers

issue.title: Feature | Add Storybook to Vivo

repository.name: calyptia-vivo
repository.description: Calyptia Vivo, live viewer for Fluent Bit data streams

issue.body:
Fixes: [1204518292849518](https://app.asana.com/0/1203879107682284/1204518292849518)

## Description of changes

Added packages and reorganized components so that they contained and can be displayed in a storybook.

## Notes for Reviewers

This is still a draft PR. Need to work on getting the build to pass.

See instructions in the README under the new section for development

## Testing

The instructions for using Vivo are in the README. Take it for a run and see if it works! Also check out the storybook build by running the storybook command in the README and visiting the components.

---
